headline: Flex Q2 Earnings & Revenues Top, Stock Up on Raised Outlook
summary: Flex posts strong fiscal Q2 2026 results with EPS and revenue beat, fueled by data center demand and raised full-year guidance.

raw.headline: Flex Q2 Earnings & Revenues Top, Stock Up on Raised Outlook
raw.summary: Flex posts strong fiscal Q2 2026 results with EPS and revenue beat, fueled by data center demand and raised full-year guidance.

headline: Fortive Q3 Earnings & Revenues Beat Estimates, Increase Y/Y, Stock Up
summary: FTV posts double-digit EPS growth and beats estimates, lifting its outlook as core revenues rise and margins expand.

raw.headline: Fortive Q3 Earnings & Revenues Beat Estimates, Increase Y/Y, Stock Up
raw.summary: FTV posts double-digit EPS growth and beats estimates, lifting its outlook as core revenues rise and margins expand.

headline: Unplanned Downtime Costs Manufacturers Up to $852M Weekly, Exposing Critical Vulnerabilities in Industrial Resilience
summary: Fluke data reveals 61 percent of manufacturers hit in the past year; outages stretch up to 72 hours and threaten profitability at the board level. Unplanned Downtime Costs Manufacturers Up to $852M Weekly, Exposing Critical Vulnerabilities in Industrial Resilience The survey, conducted by Censuswide on behalf of Fluke, surveyed 600 respondents representing manufacturing firms across the Food & Beverage, Oil & Gas, Life Sciences, and Automotive industries operating in Germany, the UK, and the US.

headline: FTV Q3 Deep Dive: Simplified Structure, Recurring Revenue Growth, and Margin Discipline Mark First Post-Spin Quarter
summary: Industrial technology company Fortive (NYSE:FTV) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.3% year on year to $1.03 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.68 per share was 19.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
